main event: Multiple groups of luminous, spherical or disc-shaped objects (or lights) were observed over El Paso, Texas in September 1952.
interesting points: The objects were observed for approximately 30 minutes, exhibiting erratic behavior including hovering and extremely high speed rotating flight.
There were several groups of objects, some traveling in formation (echelon, diagonal line of march) at estimated speeds of 600-800 mph.
The objects were described as luminous, spherical or disc-shaped, ranging in size from 30-50 feet in diameter, and flying at altitudes of 10,000-15,000 feet.
The objects did not produce any sound and had no apparent means of propulsion.
Some reports describe the objects disappearing suddenly, as if they winked out, rather than flying over the horizon.
sighted object: multiple groups of luminous, spherical or disc-shaped objects (or lights)
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
